title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Currently, I am Ph.D. Student in Political Science of the Graduate Research Group Resilient Institutions at the University of Mainz.
I receive a scholarship founded by the Gutenberg Council for Young Researchers.
In my dissertation project on Episodes of democratic erosion – sequences, opportunity structures, and patterns of autocratization under the supervision of Claudia Landwehr, I am aiming to contribute to the debate on democratic resilience.
I hold a B.A. and an M.A. in Political and Social Sciences from the University of Würzburg.
Here you can download my CV

title: Kevin Walz
text:
I am a Ph.D. student in the interdisciplinary Graduate Research Group Resilient Institutions at the University of Mainz.
My research interests cluster around means of comparative politics and especially democracy research. In particular, I engage in issues of comparative regime research, democratic legitimacy and deficit, the transformation of political systems, and democratic resilience.
You can find my full CV here.
